cs.DL, cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.IR, cs.CYBER. 

The paper discusses the analysis of research collaboration among Italian university researchers in the hard sciences, which involves the use of data and methods from several computer science subfields. Specifically, the paper proposes a new methodology for measuring the propensity to collaborate based on the classification of authors by field, which could be relevant to researchers in digital libraries (cs.DL) and information retrieval (cs.IR) who work on bibliometric analysis and author profiling. The paper also examines the collaboration behaviors of scientists in different fields, which could be of interest to researchers in social computing (cs.SOC) who study online collaboration and network analysis. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of simulations to compare the results of the proposed methodology with traditional approaches, which could be relevant to researchers in cybersecurity (cs.CYBER) who work on modeling and simulation.
